note.p: Education: St Paul's School, London; Trinity College, Cambridge (admitted 1682); Gray's Inn (admitted 1694)

Career: Called to the Bar (1703); Bencher of Gray's Inn (1724); MP for Bodmin (1713-1715); MP for Cambridge (1715, 1722-1736); bought several estates in Cambridgeshire and amassed a valuable library; died intestate with an estate worth Â£200,000
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; St Paul's; Sedgwick; GI
Notes: Proposed by John Bridges; James Jurin
